text: this damn unromantic square is where
John F Kennedy came on jun the 26 1963
to make that big speech ich bin ein
Berliner and he made it on a platform
constructed in front of that balcony
this square in front of the town hall
there was absolutely packed 120,000
people and that meant that they were
stretching far down all the side streets
he was telling them I'm one of you one
of the people of West Berlin and they
absolutely loved him for it and he came
to this place checkpoint charlie at that
time a real point of danger in the Cold
War he came from the West and looked
over towards the Soviet zone at that
time the tanks of both sides had their
barrels pointing at each other fingers
on the trigger and he came here to this
iconic backdrop President Reagan came
here after him remember he made that
speech mr. Gorbachev tear down this wall
President Obama was here this year when
Kennedy came he came in open-top car and
the people of Berlin loved that
accessibility in Dallas that openness
killed him
